description: T.12 offs.1 Black Pine - Fell (unstable).T.2910 Lombardy Poplar - 5m Reduction in height to suitable growth points and shape into remaining canopy.T.2903 Ash - Fell (Diseased).T.2836 Ash - Fell (Ash Dieback).T.2835 Red Oak - 2-3m Reduction of eastern crown to suitable growth points and shape into remaining canopy.T.2875 Hawthorn - Fell (Decayed).T.2811 Ash - Fell (Ash Dieback).T.2908 Horse Chestnut - 2-3m Holistic crown reduction to suitable growth points.T.s001 Horse Chestnut - 3m Holistic crown reduction to suitable growth points.T.2824 Hawthorn - Fell (Diseased).T.nn.1 Ash - Fell (Ash Dieback).T.2843 Hawthorn - Fell (Decayed).T.nn.8 Elm - Fell (Dead).T.nn.9 Ash - Fell (Decayed).T.2823 Liquidambar - 2m Holistic crown reduction to suitable growth points.T.2829 Ash - Fell (Ash Dieback).T.2872 Ash - Fell (Diseased).T.2909 Horse Chestnut - 2m Holistic crown reduction to suitable growth points.T.2825 Oak - Lateral reduction to suitable growth points providing 2m clearance from the adjacent building & deadwood.T.2837 Ash - Fell (Ash Dieback).T.2841 Ash - Fell (Ash Dieback).T.nn.2 Ash - Fell (Ash Dieback).T.2817 Sycamore - Crown lift to 5.5m.T.2810 Swamp Cypress - Crown lift to 4m.T.2812 Swamp Cypress - Crown lift to 4m.
decision_conditions: Under the provisions of sections 206 and 213 of the Act, the owner of the land upon which the above tree(s) are to be removed is under a duty to plant one replacement tree of appropriate size and species, per tree under TPO removed according to the above list. These should be planted as close to the original tree(s) as possible unless otherwise agreed with the Council's Tree Officer. The replacement trees should be planted within the first planting season (Oct 1st - April 30th) following the proposed removals.The size of the tree shall be a standard with a height of 2.50 metres, a minimum stem height of 1.75 metres and a girth of 8cm to 10cm to conform with BS 3936 Part 1 (1992).Any replacement trees which within a period of five years from planting are removed, die or become seriously damaged/diseased shall be replaced within the next planting season (Oct 1st to April 30th) with trees of similar amenity value.Any replacement planting should be carried out with due consideration for overhead and underground services, property boundaries, buildings and potential maintenance. The eventual size of a specimen and the nature of its rooting structure should also be taken into account when choosing where to plant, in order to achieve the best result for your site.The following will be suitable replacement species:(a) English Yew (Taxus baccata) x1 as replacement for "T.12 offs.1".(b) Aspen (Populus tremula) x10 to be planted as a group in a corner of the site as replacement for all Ash felled due to disease.I have to warn you that if the above specified replacements are not planted by the end of the first planting season (Oct 1st to April 30th) following the proposed removals, a notice may be served under section 207 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). However, I trust that such action will not be necessary and I look forward to receiving your full cooperation in this matter. Please ensure that you inform the Council's Tree Officer (ben.morgan@kingston.gov.uk) with the provision of a photo once the replanting has taken place.
